@graph.name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Brownies - JoyFoodSunshine
@graph.description: Peanut butter brownies are fudgy with a crinkly top & have chocolate & peanut butter in the batter! Made with 8 ingredients in 30 minutes!

@graph.name: Can I add a peanut butter swirl?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes! You can add a peanut butter swirl to the top of these brownies if you'd like!

@graph.name: Why do my brownies get hard?

acceptedAnswer.text: Brownies dry out if they are exposed to air or if they have been over baked.

@graph.name: How do you keep brownies soft after baking?

acceptedAnswer.text: Keep brownies stored in an airtight container. You can also soften them by gently warming them in the microwave (for 15-30 seconds) or in an oven set to warm for 5 minutes!

@graph.name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Brownies
@graph.description: These peanut butter brownies are fudgy with a shiny crinkly top and are loaded with chocolate & peanut butter in the batter. They're easy to make with 8 ingredients in 30 minutes.

video.name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Brownies
video.description: These peanut butter brownies are fudgy with a shiny crinkly top and are loaded with chocolate & peanut butter in the batter. They're easy to make with 8 ingredients in 30 minutes.

recipeIngredient: 1 cup of mix-ins (chocolate chips, peanut butter chips, nuts, etc. - optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F, grease an 8x8” baking dish, set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F, grease an 8x8” baking dish, set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix flour, cocoa powder and sea salt together in a small bowl; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix flour, cocoa powder and sea salt together in a small bowl; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Melt chocolate and butter together in a microwave safe bowl, or on the stovetop over low heat. Stir until smooth and glossy. Set aside to cool.
recipeInstructions.name: Melt chocolate and butter together in a microwave safe bowl, or on the stovetop over low heat. Stir until smooth and glossy. Set aside to cool.

recipeInstructions.text: In the bowl of a standing mixer, beat eggs and sugar for 1 minute or until pale and thick.
recipeInstructions.name: In the bowl of a standing mixer, beat eggs and sugar for 1 minute or until pale and thick.

recipeInstructions.text: Add melted chocolate/butter mixture, peanut butter and vanilla and stir on low speed until batter is smooth and homogenous (uniform throughout).
recipeInstructions.name: Add melted chocolate/butter mixture, peanut butter and vanilla and stir on low speed until batter is smooth and homogenous (uniform throughout).

recipeInstructions.text: Add dry ingredients, mix on low speed until just incorporated and there are no lumps.
recipeInstructions.name: Add dry ingredients, mix on low speed until just incorporated and there are no lumps.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in chocolate chips or your preferred mix-ins.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in chocolate chips or your preferred mix-ins.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake until the top is set and the brownies are only very slightly “jiggly”, 18-25minutes.**
recipeInstructions.name: Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake until the top is set and the brownies are only very slightly “jiggly”, 18-25minutes.**

recipeInstructions.text: Place brownie pan on a wire cooling rack to cool completely.
recipeInstructions.name: Place brownie pan on a wire cooling rack to cool completely.
